description:
After installing the runtime, and then installing the "Deezer" addon, the Deezer app cannot launch - claiming that Flash is not installed.

I'm disappointed that a) it requires Flash, and b) that it's not smart enough to install Flash by itself.

Even Google Calendar requires Flash? Nothing works at all. I really can't wait for Progressive Web Apps to be implemented more widely and for APIs like Media Controller to be supported. Will offer a better (at least functional) experience.
Use it for Yandex.Music without problems
Uninstalling because app constantly targets facebook, like opens dozens of tabs - should be fixed
summary: Works kind a but not for me

description: Doesn't work I click launch and nothing happens.
summary: Doesn't work I click launch and nothing happens

description:
I'm the developer of Nuvola Apps and I try hard to make my official builds at https://nuvola.tiliado.eu/ work out of the box. All necessary dependencies are provided by the shared GNOME Platform runtime, bundled with Nuvola, or downloaded upon user's approval (Widevine, only for Spotify). Reading the comments here, it's sad that it is not the same in the case of Fedora's packages.

"After installing the runtime, and then installing the "Deezer" addon, the Deezer app cannot launch - claiming that Flash is not installed. I'm disappointed that a) it requires Flash, and b) that it's not smart enough to install Flash by itself." -- My builds use Chromium engine instead of WebKitGTK, so most steaming services can play without Flash plugin and the remaining stubborn ones download Flash by themselves.

"Even Google Calendar requires Flash? Nothing works at all." -- It does not require Flash in the official builds.
summary: Huge difference in quality between official builds and Fedora's ones

description:
I was looking for a way to put Soundcloud - Deezer - TuneIn in a single easily accessible source with keyboard shortcuts, Nuvola was up to the task. It worked like a charm on arch linux and global keyboard shortcuts worked out of the box. No need to switch to firefox and find the correct tab to control the music. I can just push the play/pause while coding :D. Besides, the memory is well managed, doesn't eat up lots of ram. 
Kudos for the developer!! Great job (y)
summary: Works like a charm on arch linux

description: It wont remove from system,,, Going for law suit
summary: It wont remove from system,,, Going for law suit

description: I need it exactly for one reason - I want to be able to control deezer with multimedia buttons
Tidal's web app currently requires Flash, and there isn't a native Linux app for it. This platform resolves that issue and adds additional integration with services such as Last.fm.
still 99% until I cancel the installation
I've purchased lifetime license and I'm not disappointed.
summary: The greatest apps for playing music from web

description: Using it with Spotify, earlier with YouTube Music. Couldn't be happier.
